doc.after: Water is a common chemical substance that is essential for the survival of all known forms of life. In typical usage, water refers to its liquid form or state, but the substance also has a solid state, ice, and a gaseous state, water vapor or steam. AboutÂ 1.460Â petatonnesÂ (Pt) (1021Â kilograms) of water covers 71% of the Earth's surface, mostly in oceans and other large water bodies, with 1.6% of water below ground in aquifers and 0.001% in the air as vapor, clouds (formed of solid and liquid water particles suspended in air), and precipitation.
